description: 4for4 Fantasy Football's John Paulsen and Anthony Stalter digest, discuss and analyze the world of fantasy football throughout the year with conversation focused squarely on helping you win your league. From free agency to the NFL Draft to training camp battles, they'll help you prepare for your league's fantasy draft. Once the season begins, they'll discuss lineup strategy, weekly waiver wire pickups and sneaky starts. Paulsen finished in the Top 5 in rankings accuracy in 2010, 2011, 2012, 2014, and 2015, making this fantasy football's Most Accurate Podcast!
title: The Most Accurate Podcast: Fantasy Football News & Strategy by 4for4

episodes.title: Week 10 Recap & Week 11 Waivers with Alex Gelhar
episodes.description:
Summary

On this episode of The Most Accurate Podcast, Alex Gelhar joins Greg to recap Week 10 and work the Week 11 waiver wire. Your hosts begin by discussing the upset-heavy results from Sunday, then profile their booms and busts of the week, including some busts who might qualify as buy-lows. From there, the conversation pivots to the viability of "buying low." It's harder than ever, and your hosts speculate on how traders can find edges when the modern fantasy player is so well-informed. Then it's on to the impact of key injuries from Week 10, including those to Matthew Stafford, Austin Hooper, Brian Allen, Marshon Lattimore, and Patrick Peterson. The show winds down with waiver pick-up recommendations for each position (26:32). Who is the best bargain basement QB streamer? Is Brian Hill or Derrius Guice the better RB addition? Do we need to pay attention to Darrel Williams or Darwin Thompson? How about Russell Gage? Is O.J. Howard's fantasy value back from the dead? Who are the best streaming defenses for Week 11? Listen in and find out.

The show is brought to you by FantasyDraft. Sign up using the promo code 4for4 and you’ll get a free 7-day trial membership.

episodes.title: Week 7 Recap & Week 8 Waivers with Greg Smith
episodes.description:
Summary

On this episode of The Most Accurate Podcast, Greg Smith is all alone to recap Week 7 and work the waiver wire for Week 8. He kicks off the show discussing the impact of injuries and byes on the transactions leading up to Week 7, then he wonders if home field advantage in the NFL is largely dead. Booms of the week and busts of the week are next, with a lot of time spent on surprising performances from the Lions, Cardinals, and Saints. From there, Greg dives into key injuries from Week 7 (19:29). Can the Chiefs' offense maintain high-level fantasy production with Matt Moore under center? How about the Falcons with Matt Schaub at quarterback? Injuries from other positions are also discussed, and those lead right into Greg's assessment of the Week 8 waiver wire (24:27). Which handcuff running backs are most likely to break out next ala Chase Edmonds in Week 7? Do fantasy owners need to give serious consideration to Mark Walton and Brandon Bolden? Is Anthony Miller finally coming around? What's it going to take for DeVante Parker and Preston Williams to crack 25% ownership? Is there any hope left for O.J. Howard? And if not, which other tight ends might offer non-zero production off waivers? Greg tackles all these questions and more, so tune and help make sure he wasn't just talking to himself that whole time.

episodes.description:
Summary

From there, Greg grills Pat on players he has ranked significantly higher or lower than ADP, going from running backs (17:17) to wide receivers (26:49), then quarterbacks (46:07) and tight ends (54:46). After a quick discussion on the politics and etiquette of slow drafts like the SFB and some general strategy talk from Pat, your hosts finish out the show with a boxing-style accounting of who won each round drafting from the 1.06 spot.

episodes.title: Minining for Mid-Round Values with Evan Silva
episodes.description: On this episode of The Most Accurate Podcast, presented by DRAFT, Evan Silva of EstablishTheRun.com joins Greg Smith for their annual fantasy football draft strategy deep dive. Kicking things off in the Fourth of July spirit, Evan identifies an early round player likely to celebrate newfound fantasy independence this season, then he discusses a pair of teams that captured his interest while editing Warren Sharp's 2019 Football Preview. After a quick check-in on the Dallas Cowboys' depth chart, Evan and Greg get to the meat of the episode, outlining how positional values and positional reliability should inform draft strategies. That conversation continues with an accounting of mid-round running backs and wide receivers to target depending on those early-round draft strategies drafters employ. Tune in and take your fantasy game to the next level.

episodes.title: 2019 Offseason Division Breakdown: AFC West & AFC South
episodes.description: Previewing the AFC South and AFC West! Will Lamar Miller hold off D'Onta Foreman? Who is the WR2 in Houston--Will Fuller or Keke Coutee? How will the targets be distributed in Indianapolis? Can Marcus Mariota put it all together in his fifth season? Is Derrick Henry worthy of a third round pick? What does Nick Foles bring to the Jacksonville passing game? Is there value in the Jaguars' receiving corps? Will Damien Williams be the clear RB1 in Kansas City? How does the Chiefs' passing attack look if Tyreek Hill doesn't play? Are Mike Williams and Hunter Henry both destined for breakout seasons? Who will get the most carries for the Broncos? How does Emmanuel Sanders' recovery affect the Denver receiving corps? Can Tyrell Williams be an every-week fantasy starter? Does Josh Jacobs have top five potential? Who's going to replace Jared Cook. John Paulsen and Anthony Stalter discuss these situations and more on the latest episode of The Most Accurate Podcast.

episodes.title: 2019 Offseason Division Breakdown: AFC North & AFC East
episodes.description: Will the Ravens continue to run the ball at historically high rates or will the team trust Lamar Jackson more as a passer? What is Mark Ingram's upside in this offense? How are the Steelers going to replace the production of Le'Veon Bell and Antonio Brown? Is the hype surrounding Baker Mayfield justified and what's his ceiling with Odell Beckham in Cleveland? Should owners be worried about Nick Chubb with Kareem Hunt looming? With A.J. Green back does Tyler Boyd still have WR2-type upside? Is Andy Dalton a threat to finish with QB1 numbers? How are the Patriots going to replace Rob Gronkowski? Who leads the New England backfield in touches? Is there any value to be found in Miami? What about Buffalo? Is Bell going to return to form playing for a new team? How are targets going to shake out for the Jets? Anthony Stalter and John Paulsen answer these burning questions as they preview the AFC North and AFC East on the latest episode of The Most Accurate Podcast.

episodes.title: Second-Tier RBs, Breakouts and Busts with Michael Beller
episodes.description: On this episode of The Most Accurate Podcast, Michael Beller of Sports Illustrated joins Greg Smith, and they begin the show with an in-depth talk about fantasy football's second tier of running backs, from David Johnson at an ADP around pick six down to Nick Chubb at an ADP around pick 20. Later, your hosts use Michael's recent articles at SI.com on sleepers, busts, breakouts, and bouncebacks as a jumping off point to discuss the fantasy outlooks for the New York Jets, the Kansas City Chiefs, and a handful of other notable players. Which running backs from outside the top-four at the position have the best chance to finish as the overall RB1? Who is the second receiving option to own behind Robby Anderson in New York? What can we expect from Sam Darnold in year two? Can Sammy Watkins deliver on his long fabled WR1 upside, and if not, what does that mean for Patrick Mahomes? Tune in for takes on all these questions and more.

episodes.title: Depth Chart Traps with Pete Davidson
episodes.description: On this episode of The Most Accurate Podcast, Pete Davidson joins Greg Smith. After they review Pete's strategy in 4for4's recent 12-team PPR mock draft, your hosts dig into tight end evaluations, examine the 49ers depth chart, and try to identify potential traps in other NFL depth charts that could mislead drafters. Where are the early-round pivot points between top-tier running backs, wide receivers, and tight ends? Who are the best late-round tight ends to target? Is there any hope of Rob Gronkowski unretiring and what's he worth in dynasty leagues? Is Jimmy Garoppolo undervalued, and who will he get the ball to the most? Which teams' depth charts might be lying to us about the opportunities their players will actually see this season? Pete and Greg tackle all these subjects and more, then they close out the show with a checkup on the hype levels of a handful of quarterbacks, including Cam Newton, Kyler Murray, and others.

episodes.title: 2019 Offseason Division Breakdown: NFC North & NFC East
episodes.description: What should owners do with Tyreek Hill? Who's going to lead the Bears' backfield in fantasy points? Is Trey Burton worth targeting again? episodes.title: 2013E01 The Most Accurate Podcast -- 4for4.com Fantasy Football
episodes.description: Subscribers have been asking for it for years, and we're excited to announce 4for4 Fantasy Football finally has a podcast! John Paulsen and Anthony Stalter will be your hosts as they digest, discuss and analyze the world of fantasy football throughout the year. From free agency to the NFL Draft to training camp battles, they'll help you prepare for your league's fantasy draft. Once the season begins, they'll discuss lineup strategy, weekly waiver wire pickups and sneaky starts. Paulsen finished in the Top 5 in weekly rankings accuracy in 2010, 2011 and 2012, making this fantasy football's Most Accurate Podcast.
